page.title: 18HOUSING
page.content: {THE ESTATES OF MARSH FARM AND SUNDON {PARK}The houses in the urban area of Sundon Park were built mostly in the 1960's and 1970's. Most of the houses are either terraced or semi-detached. Few houses had garages next to them and in narrow streets they had to park their cars in the drive or in the road. The earliest houses were in the 1950's these have rounded windows. The three main roads in Sundon Park are Grampian Way,Hill Rise and Sundon Road. The other roads are fairly quiet.There were twenty eight shops serving the community,these included a supermarket, post office, betting shop,video shop and library. Marsh Farm is made up of mainly council houses. The buildings are predominantly brick built, many of them being terraced.
